intro: Logania imbricata, commonly known as the African star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped white flowers. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. It is a deciduous shrub that can grow up to 3 meters tall, with woody stems and showy inflorescences. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects, making it an important plant in local ecosystems.
